meanings.definition: To bend or crease something in order to make it smaller or neater.
meanings.sent1: I always foldup my clothes before putting them in the drawer.
meanings.sent2: She carefully foldup the paper airplane before throwing it.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to foldup the giant balloon animal, but it kept popping!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to foldup at the corners, revealing her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The old map was so delicate that it would foldup at the slightest touch.

meanings.definition: A portable piece of furniture that can be folded for easy storage.
meanings.sent1: We brought a foldup chair to the picnic for extra seating.
meanings.sent2: The camping table was a convenient foldup that fit in the trunk.
meanings.sent3: The tiny foldup table collapsed under the weight of the cake.
meanings.sent4: His dreams of a foldup bed in the tiny apartment were dashed by the landlord.
meanings.sent5: The foldup stool was a lifesaver during the outdoor concert.

meanings.definition: The act of folding something up.
meanings.sent1: The foldup of the map revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent2: After the show, the foldup of the chairs signaled the end of the event.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected foldup of the umbrella caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The foldup of the letter was a symbol of closure for the relationship.
meanings.sent5: The quick foldup of the tent saved them from the sudden rainstorm.
